intro: Colanthelia lanciflora, commonly known as the lancifoliate colanthelia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves, which are typically arranged in a basal rosette. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are often white or pale pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
